citing_paper_authors: Kaoru, Yamamoto | Taku, Kudo | Yuta, Tsuboi | Yuji, Matsumoto
raw_text: Thishighlights the need for finding multi-word translation cor respondences. Previous works that focus on multi-word translation correspondences from parallel corpora include noun phrase correspondences (Kupiec, 1993) ,fixed/flexiblecollocations (Smadja et al, 1996), n-gram word sequences of arbitrary length (Kitamura and Matsumoto, 1996), non-compositional compounds (Melamed, 2001) ,captoids (Moore, 2001), and named entities 1
clean_text: Previous works that focus on multi-word translation correspondences from parallel corpora include noun phrase correspondences (Kupiec, 1993), fixed/flexiblecollocations (Smadja et al, 1996), n-gram word sequences of arbitrary length (Kitamura and Matsumoto, 1996), non-compositional compounds (Melamed, 2001), captoids (Moore, 2001), and named entities.

citing_paper_authors: Kaoru, Yamamoto | Taku, Kudo | Yuta, Tsuboi | Yuji, Matsumoto
raw_text: Kupiec (1993) focuses on noun-phrase translation sonly, Smadja et al (1996) limits to find French translation of English collocation identified by his Xtract system, and Kitamura and Matsumoto (1996) can exhaustively enumerate only rigid word sequences
clean_text: Kupiec (1993) focuses on noun-phrase translations only, Smadja et al (1996) limits to find French translation of English collocation identified by his Xtract system, and Kitamura and Matsumoto (1996) can exhaustively enumerate only rigid word sequences.

citing_paper_authors: Els, Lefever | Lieve, Macken | Véronique, Hoste
raw_text: Most bilingual terminology extraction systems first identify candidate terms in the source language based on predefined source patterns, and then select translation candidates for these terms in the target language (Kupiec, 1993) .We present an alternative approach that generates candidate terms directly from the aligned words and phrases in our parallel corpus
clean_text: Most bilingual terminology extraction systems first identify candidate terms in the source language based on predefined source patterns, and then select translation candidates for these terms in the target language (Kupiec, 1993).

raw_text: Part-ofspeech taggers are used in a few applications, such as speech synthesis (Sproat et al, 1992) and question answering (Kupiec, 1993b)
clean_text: Part-of-speech taggers are used in a few applications, such as speech synthesis (Sproat et al, 1992) and question answering (Kupiec, 1993b).
